summary: The term "LAFTA countries" refers to the member states of the Latin American Free Trade Association, which have been redirected to the preferred term "ALADI countries," denoting members of the Asociación Latinoamericana de Integración. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, understanding the economic geography of ALADI countries is crucial for formulating trade agreements and economic policies. The EU engages with these nations to enhance bilateral trade relations, promote economic cooperation, and facilitate regulatory alignment. This engagement is pivotal for addressing trade barriers and fostering sustainable economic growth within the broader Latin American region.
